translation: Foshuo Chang'ahan jing, vol. 11

source_sentence: 後秦弘始年佛陀耶舍共竺佛念譯
translation: Latter-Qin Emperor Hiroshi's year, Buddhayaśas and Zhufo Nianshi

source_sentence: （一五）第二分阿[少/兔]夷經第十一
translation: (155) Second Part of the A[lesser/rabbit] Ekaviṃśati-sūtra, Eleventh

source_sentence: 如是我聞：一時，佛在冥寧國阿[少/兔]夷土，與大比丘眾千二百五十人俱。
translation: Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was in the land of A[shaughn]i in the country of Mīnin, accompanied by a large assembly of twelve hundred and fifty monks.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊著衣持鉢，入阿[少/兔]夷城乞食。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān put on his robe and took his bowl into Ajita to solicit alms.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊默自念言：「我今乞食，於時如早，今宜往詣房伽婆梵志園觀。」
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān silently thought to himself, "Now that I've begged for alms, it's a good idea to go to the Brahma's garden in Fangabal."

source_sentence: 比丘須時至，然後乞食。
translation: The monks had to arrive at that time, and then they begged for food.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊即詣彼園，時，彼梵志遙見佛來，即起奉迎，共相問訊，言：「善來，瞿曇！
translation: When the Bhagavān then went to that park, the priests who saw the Buddha coming from afar rose to greet him and exchanged greetings, saying, "Good coming, Gautama!

source_sentence: 不面來久，今以何緣乃能屈顧？
translation: What are the reasons why I've been able to give up after not seeing him for so long?

source_sentence: 唯願瞿曇就此處坐！」
translation: May the Gautama sit in this place!"

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊即就其坐。
translation: At that point, the Bhagavān took his seat.

source_sentence: 時，彼梵志於一面坐，白世尊言：「先夜隸車子善宿比丘來至我所，語我言：『大師！
translation: Sitting at one side, that priest said to the Bhagavān, "The night before, the monk Licchavi Sunjū came to me and said, 'Great teacher!

source_sentence: 我不於佛所修梵行也。
translation: "I don't cultivate the religious practice in the Buddha's hall.

source_sentence: 所以然者？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 佛疎外我。』
translation: The Buddha has outsmarted me.'

source_sentence: 彼人見向說瞿曇過，雖有此言，我亦不受。」
translation: Even though that person sees and tells you the error of the Gautama, I won't accept such words."

source_sentence: 佛告梵志：「彼善宿所言，知汝不受耳。
translation: The Buddha told the priest, "What that good constellation said, I know you won't accept it.

source_sentence: 昔我一時在毗舍離獼猴池側集法堂上，時，此善宿來至我所，語我言：『如來外我，我不於如來所修梵行也。』
translation: One time, I was in the Dharma hall near Vaiśālī's monkey pond when this good lodger came to me and said, 'The Tathāgata is outside of me, and I'm not cultivating the religious practice in the Tathāgata's place.'

source_sentence: 我時告曰：『汝何故言：我不於如來所修梵行，如來外我耶？』
translation: I then told him, 'Why do you say, 'I don't cultivate the religious practice in the Tathāgata's place, and the Tathāgata is outside of me?'

source_sentence: 善宿報我言：『如來不為我現神足變化。』
translation: The good constellation replied to me, 'The Tathāgata doesn't manifest miraculous powers for me.'

source_sentence: 「時，我語言：『吾可請汝於我法中淨修梵行，當為汝現神足耶？』
translation: "I then said, 'May I ask you to purify your religious practice in my teaching, and will I show you miraculous powers?'

source_sentence: 復當語我：『如來當為我現神足變化，然後我當修梵行耶？』
translation: Again, you will say to me, 'Will the Tathāgata show me miraculous powers and transform me, and then I will practice the religious life?'

source_sentence: 時，善宿報我言：『不也。
translation: Then, the good constellation answered me, 'No.'

source_sentence: 世尊！』
translation: Bhagavān!"

source_sentence: 佛告善宿：『我亦不語汝言：汝於我法中淨修梵行，當為汝現神足變化；汝亦不言為我現神足者，當修梵行。
translation: The Buddha told Shansui, "I also don't say to you, 'I won't tell you, 'Cultivate pure religious practice in my teaching, and I will show you the transformation of your spiritual powers;' and you don't say, 'I'll cultivate religious practice for those of you who have my spiritual powers.'

source_sentence: 云何？
translation: How is that?

source_sentence: 善宿！
translation: Good night!

source_sentence: 如汝意者，謂如來能現神足、為不能現耶？
translation: If that's what you think, does it mean that the Tathāgata is capable of manifesting miraculous powers, or is it incapable of doing so?

source_sentence: 我所說法，彼法能得出要，盡苦際不耶？』
translation: Do I explain that this teaching can lead to the essentials and end suffering?'

source_sentence: 善宿白佛言：『如是，世尊！
translation: Sun-Suk said to the Buddha, 'So it is, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 如來能現神足，非為不能，所可說法，能得出要，盡諸苦際，非為不盡。』
translation: It's not that the Tathāgata is capable of displaying miraculous abilities, that he's unable to teach, that he's able to give the essentials, and that he's able to end suffering, but it's not that he doesn't end it.'

source_sentence: 『是故，善宿！
translation: 'Therefore, good constellation!

source_sentence: 我所說法修梵行者，能現神足，非為不能，出要離苦，非不能離，汝於此法欲何所求？』
translation: It's not that those who practice the religious life according to my teaching are incapable of manifesting supernormal powers and are not unable to escape from suffering, so what do you want from this teaching?'

source_sentence: 「善宿言：『世尊！
translation: "The good constellation said, 'Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 不能隨時教我，我父祕術，世尊盡知，悋不教我。』
translation: He couldn't teach me at any time, and the Bhagavān knew all of my father's secrets but didn't teach me about them at a high price.'

source_sentence: 佛言：『善宿！
translation: The Buddha said, 'Good night!

source_sentence: 我頗曾言：汝於我法中修梵行者，教汝父術耶？
translation: Did I ever say, "Do you teach your father the ways of those who practice the religious life in my teaching?

source_sentence: 汝頗復言：教我父術者，當於佛所修梵行耶？』
translation: Would you further say, 'He who teaches my father the arts will cultivate the religious practice in the Buddha's place?'

source_sentence: 答曰：『不也。』
translation: They replied, 'No.'

source_sentence: 『是故，善宿！
translation: 'So, good constellation!

source_sentence: 我先無此言，汝亦無言，今者何故作此語耶？
translation: I didn't say this before, and you didn't say it either, so why are you saying this now?

source_sentence: 云何？
translation: How is it?

source_sentence: 善宿！
translation: Good night!

source_sentence: 汝謂如來能說汝父祕術，為不能說耶？
translation: Do you think the Tathāgata can explain your father's secret techniques, but why can't he?

source_sentence: 所可說法，能得出要，盡苦際不耶？』
translation: Is there a teaching that can be given that will get to the essentials and end the limit of suffering?'

source_sentence: 善宿報言：『如來能說父之祕術，非為不能；說法出要，能盡苦際，非為不能。』
translation: The good constellation replied, 'It's not that the Tathāgata is able to teach his father's secret techniques, and it's not that he's unable to teach what's essential and can end suffering.'

source_sentence: 佛告善宿：『若我能說汝父祕術，亦能說法出要離苦，汝於我法中復欲何求？』
translation: The Buddha told Shansuo, 'If I could teach your father's secret techniques and could also teach the Dharma to escape from suffering, what else would you want from my Dharma?'

source_sentence: 又告善宿：『汝先於毗舍離跋闍土地，無數方便，稱歎如來，稱歎正法，稱歎眾僧。
translation: He also told Shansuo, "In the land of Vaiśālībhaja, you praised the Tathāgata, praised the right teaching, and praised the monks in countless ways.

source_sentence: 譬如有人八種稱歎彼清涼池，使人好樂：一冷，二輕，三柔，四清，五甘，六無垢，七飲無饜，八便身。
translation: It's like a person who praises that cool lake in eight ways that make people happy: first, it's cold, second, light, third, gentle, fourth, pure, fifth, sweet, sixth, spotless, seven, unsatisfied with drinking, and eighth, it facilitates the body.

source_sentence: 汝亦如是，於毘舍離跋闍土，稱歎如來，稱歎正法，稱歎眾僧，使人信樂。
translation: In the same way, you praise the Tathāgata, praise the right teaching, and praise the monks in the land of Vaiśālībhaja, making people believe in them.

source_sentence: 善宿！
translation: Good constellation!

source_sentence: 當知今汝退者，世間當復有言：善宿比丘多有知識，又是世尊所親，亦是世尊弟子，不能盡形淨修梵行，捨戒就俗處，卑陋行。』
translation: You should know that now you've withdrawn, and the world will again say, 'That monk Sunjū has many friends, is close to the Bhagavān, and is a disciple of the Bhagavān, but he can't completely purify his appearance and cultivate the religious practice; he leaves the precepts and goes to a secular place, which is a humble practice.'

source_sentence: 梵志！
translation: Brahmā!

source_sentence: 當知我時備語，不順我教，捨戒就俗。
translation: You should know that I sometimes prepare statements that aren't in accord with my teaching, so you abandon the precepts and go lay.

source_sentence: 「梵志！
translation: "Brahmā!

source_sentence: 一時，我在獼猴池側法講堂上，時，有尼乾子，字伽羅樓，在彼處止，人所宗敬，名稱遠聞，多有知識，利養備具。
translation: One time, I was in a Dharma discussion hall near the monkey pond when there was Nirgrantha, a man named Garāḍa, who stayed there, was held in high esteem, was well-known, had many friends, and was well supplied with benefits.

source_sentence: 時，善宿比丘著衣持鉢，入毗舍離城乞食，漸漸轉到尼乾子所。
translation: The monk Shansui then put on his robe and took his bowl into Vaiśālī to solicit alms and gradually made his way to Nirgrantha's place.

source_sentence: 爾時，善宿以深遠義問尼乾子，彼不能答，便生瞋恚。
translation: Shansui then asked Nirgrantha about the profound meaning of the teaching, but he couldn't answer, so he became angry.

source_sentence: 善宿自念：『我觸嬈此人，將無長夜有苦惱報耶？』
translation: Shansui thought to himself, 'Will this person I've come in contact with bring the results of suffering and distress for a long time?'

source_sentence: 梵志！
translation: Brahmacārī!

source_sentence: 當知時善宿比丘於乞食後，執持衣鉢，來至我所，頭面禮足，在一面坐，善宿爾時亦不以此緣告我，我語之曰：『愚人！
translation: You should know that when the monk Sunjū came to me with his robe and bowl after soliciting alms, paid homage with his head and feet, and sat down to one side, and Sunjū didn't tell me about it, I said to him, 'Fool!

source_sentence: 汝寧可自稱為沙門釋子耶？』
translation: How could you call yourself an ascetic or Śākyamuni?'

source_sentence: 善宿尋報我言：『世尊！
translation: The good constellation sought me out, saying, 'Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 何故稱我為愚？
translation: Why do you call me a fool?

source_sentence: 不應自稱為釋子耶？』
translation: Shouldn't you claim to be the Śākyamuni?'

source_sentence: 我告之曰：『愚人！
translation: I said to him, 'Fool!

source_sentence: 汝曾往至尼乾子所問深遠義，彼不能報，便生瞋恚。
translation: "You once went to Nirgrantha and asked him about his profound meaning, but he couldn't respond, so you became angry.

source_sentence: 汝時自念：我今觸此尼乾，將無長夜有苦惱報耶？
translation: Did you then think to yourself, "Now that I've touched this Nirgrantha, will there be no long night of painful retribution?

source_sentence: 汝有是念不？』
translation: Do you have this thought?'

source_sentence: 「善宿白佛言：『彼是羅漢，何緣乃有此嫉恚心？』
translation: "The good constellation said to the Buddha, 'What is the reason he's a arhat and has this jealousy?'

source_sentence: 我時答曰：『愚人！
translation: I then replied, 'Fool!

source_sentence: 羅漢何緣有嫉恚心？
translation: What causes a arhat to be jealous?

source_sentence: 非我羅漢有嫉恚心，汝今自謂彼是羅漢，彼有七苦行，長夜執持。
translation: "It's not that my arhat is jealous, but now you say he's a arhat who has seven ascetic practices that he observes throughout the night.

source_sentence: 何謂七？
translation: What are the seven?

source_sentence: 一盡形壽不著衣裳。
translation: One, he doesn't wear robes for the rest of his life.

source_sentence: 二盡形壽不飲酒食肉，而不食飯及與麨麵。
translation: Second, he doesn't drink wine and eat meat, and he doesn't eat rice or bread and noodles for the rest of his life.

source_sentence: 三盡形壽不犯梵行。
translation: Three, he doesn't violate the religious practice for the rest of his life.

source_sentence: 四盡形壽毗舍離有四石塔——東名憂園塔、南名象塔、西名多子塔、北名七聚塔；盡形不離四塔，為四苦行，而彼後當犯此七苦行已，於毗舍離城外命終。
translation: For the fourth full lifespan, there are four stone stūpas in Vaiśālī-an eastern stūpa called the Garden of Sorrows, a southern stūpa called the Elephant Stūpa, a western stūpa called the Tower of Many Children, and a northern stūpa called the Seven Aggregates Stūpa-that don't part from the four stūpas for the full lifespan, which are four ascetic practices, and after they commit these seven ascetic practices, they'll die outside Vaiśālī.

source_sentence: 譬如野干疥癩衰病，死丘塚間，彼尼乾子亦復如是；自為禁法，後盡犯之。
translation: Like a wild man with scabies and a debilitating disease who dies in a mound, so does that Nirgrantha, who establishes his own prohibitions and then violates them completely.

source_sentence: 本自誓言：盡形不著衣服，後還著衣。
translation: He originally vowed not to wear robes for the rest of his life, but then he returned to wearing them.

source_sentence: 本自誓言：盡形壽不飲酒噉肉，不食飯及麨麵，而後盡食。
translation: He originally vowed not to drink wine and devour meat, or to eat rice and flour for the rest of his life, but then he would eat them all.

source_sentence: 本自誓言：不犯梵行，而後亦犯。
translation: He originally vowed not to violate the religious practice and then did so again.

source_sentence: 本言：不越四塔——東憂園塔、南象塔、西多子塔、北七聚塔；今盡遠離不復親近。
translation: He said: "I won't cross four stūpas - the Eastern Tower of Avalokitêśvara, the Southern Tower of Elephants, the Western Tower of Many Children, and the Northern Tower of Seven Gatherings - and now I'll distance myself from them completely and not approach them again.

source_sentence: 彼人自違此七誓已，出毘舍離城，塚間命終。』
translation: After he violates these seven vows, he leaves Vaiśālī and dies in a tomb.'

source_sentence: 佛告善宿曰：『愚人！
translation: The Buddha told Sun-Sukyuk, 'Fool!

source_sentence: 汝不信我言，汝自往觀，自當知耳。』」
translation: If you don't believe my words, go and see for yourself, and you will know for yourself.'"

source_sentence: 佛告梵志：「一時，比丘善宿著衣持鉢，入城乞食，乞食已，還出城，於空塚間見尼乾子於彼命終。
translation: The Buddha told the Brahmā, "One time, a monk well-versed in putting on his robe and carrying his bowl went into town to solicit alms, and after soliciting alms, he returned out of town and saw Nirgrantha dying in an empty tomb.

source_sentence: 見已，來至我所，頭面禮足，在一面坐，不以此事而語我言。
translation: After he saw him, he came to me, bowed his head and feet, sat down at one side, and said to me, 'This is not the reason you're talking to me.'

source_sentence: 梵志！
translation: "Brahmā!

source_sentence: 當知我爾時語善宿曰：『云何？
translation: You should know that I then said to the good constellation, 'What's the answer?'

source_sentence: 善宿！
translation: Good night!

source_sentence: 我先所記尼乾子如我語不？』
translation: Did Nirgrantha, whom I had previously written down, say what I did?'

source_sentence: 對曰：『如是，如世尊言。』
translation: He said, 'So it is, just as the Bhagavān said.'

source_sentence: 梵志！
translation: Brahmā!

source_sentence: 當知我與善宿現神通證，而彼言：『世尊不為我現。』
translation: You should know that I and the good constellation showed supernormal realization, and they said, 'The Bhagavān doesn't take me for granted.'

source_sentence: 「又一時，我在冥寧國白土之邑，時有尼乾子，名究羅帝，在白土住，人所宗敬，名稱遠聞，多得利養。
translation: "Another time, I was in the White Land town of Miliṇḍa when there was a Nirgrantha named Charade who lived in the White Land, was held in high esteem by people, was well-known, and had gained much profit.

source_sentence: 時，我著衣持鉢，入城乞食，時善宿比丘隨我後行，見究羅帝尼乾子在糞堆上伏舐糠糟。
translation: When I was dressed in my robe and carrying my bowl, I went into town to solicit alms, and a monk from Sunsuke followed me there, and he saw Nirgrantha lackey lapping up chaff on a pile of dung.

source_sentence: 梵志！
translation: Brahmā!

source_sentence: 當知時善宿比丘見此尼乾子在糞堆上伏舐糠糟已，作是念言：『世間諸有阿羅漢、向阿羅漢道者無有及此，此尼乾子其道最勝，所以者何？
translation: It was then that the monk Sunjū saw this naked kid licking the chaff off a pile of dung and had this thought, 'There's no arhat in the world who's headed for the arhat path, but this naked kid's path is the most superior.

source_sentence: 此人苦行乃能如是，除捨憍慢，於糞堆上伏舐糠糟。』
translation: Such a person's austerities make it possible for him to thus rid himself of pride and lick the chaff from a pile of dung.'

source_sentence: 「梵志！
translation: "Brahmā!

source_sentence: 時，我右旋告善宿曰：『汝意愚人！
translation: I then turned to the right of the good constellation and said, 'Foolish man, what do you think!

source_sentence: 寧可自稱為釋子耶？』
translation: How could you call yourself a son of the Śākyas?'

source_sentence: 善宿白佛言：『世尊！
translation: Sun-Suk said to the Buddha, 'Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 何故稱我為愚？
translation: Why do you call me a fool?

source_sentence: 不應自稱為釋子耶？』
translation: Shouldn't you claim to be the Śākyamuni?'

source_sentence: 佛告善宿言：『汝愚人！
translation: The Buddha addressed Sun-Suk, saying, 'You fool!

source_sentence: 觀此究羅帝蹲糞堆上伏食糠糟，汝見已，作是念：諸世間阿羅漢及向羅漢者，此究羅帝最為尊上，所以者何？
translation: When you see this ascetic crouching on a pile of dung and crouching down to eat chaff, you think, "Among the arhats and arhats who face the world, this ascetic is the most venerable.

source_sentence: 今此究羅帝乃能苦行，除捨憍慢，蹲糞堆上伏舐糠糟。
translation: Now, Charlatan is able to practice austerity, rid himself of pride, and squat on a pile of dung to lick the chaff.

source_sentence: 汝有是念不？』
translation: Do you have this thought?'

source_sentence: 答我言：『實爾。』
translation: He answered me, 'So it is.'

source_sentence: 善宿又言：『何故？
translation: Again, Sun-Suk said, 'Why is that?'

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 於阿羅漢所生嫉妬心。』
translation: jealousy arises in the place of an arhat.'

source_sentence: 佛告愚人：『我不於羅漢所生嫉妬心，何為於羅漢所生嫉妬心？
translation: The Buddha told this foolish man, 'Why do I become jealous in the place of arhats when I don't become jealous in the place of arhats?'

source_sentence: 汝今愚人！
translation: You fool now!

source_sentence: 謂究羅帝真阿羅漢，此人却後七日當腹脹命終，生起屍餓鬼中，常苦飢餓，其命終後，以葦索繫抴於塚間。
translation: This is called a true arhat who, after passing away for seven days, will die of a distended belly and be born among corpses and hungry ghosts, always suffering and starving, and after his life ends, he'll be tied up with a reed rope and borne in a tomb.

source_sentence: 汝若不信者，可先往語之。』
translation: If you don't believe him, go ahead and tell him.'

source_sentence: 「時，善宿即往詣究羅帝所，說言：『彼沙門瞿曇記汝：却後七日當腹脹命終，生起屍餓鬼中，死已以葦索繫抴於塚間。』
translation: "Sun-Suk then went to Śrāvastī and said, 'That ascetic Gautama told you, 'Seven days from now, your belly will swell up and you'll die, be born among corpses and hungry ghosts, and after you die, you'll be tied up with a reed rope and put in a tomb.'

source_sentence: 善宿復白：『汝當省食，勿使彼言當也。』
translation: Again, the good constable said, 'Save your food, and don't let him say that you will.'

source_sentence: 梵志！
translation: Brahmā!

source_sentence: 當知時究羅帝至滿七日腹脹而死，即生起屍餓鬼中，死屍以葦索繫抴於塚間。
translation: It should be noted that when his belly bursts at the end of seven days, Qurati dies and is born among the hungry ghosts, and the dead corpse is tied up with a reed rope between the graves.

source_sentence: 爾時，善宿聞佛語已，屈指計日，至七日已，時，善宿比丘即往至裸形村中，到已，問其村人曰：『諸賢！
translation: After Sunjū heard what the Buddha said, he counted the days with his fingers, and when seven days had passed, the monk Sunjū went to the village of Naked, and when he arrived, he asked the villagers, 'Good men!

source_sentence: 究羅帝今何所在？』
translation: Where is Rudita now?'

source_sentence: 報曰：『已取命終。』
translation: He replied, 'I've taken my life to be over.'

source_sentence: 問曰：『何患命終耶？』
translation: He asked, 'What's the danger of your life ending?'

source_sentence: 答曰：『腹脹。』
translation: He answered, 'My belly is distended.'

source_sentence: 問曰：『云何殯送？』
translation: He asked, 'What's a funeral?'

source_sentence: 答曰：『以葦索繫抴於塚間。』
translation: He answered, 'Tethered between the tumuli with a reed rope.'

source_sentence: 「梵志！
translation: "Brahmā!

source_sentence: 時，善宿聞此語已，即往塚間，欲至未至，時，彼死屍竝動膝脚，忽爾而蹲，時彼善宿故前到死屍所，語言：『究羅帝！
translation: When the good constellation heard this, he went to the tomb, intending to reach it but not yet arriving, and the corpse moved its knees and feet and suddenly crouched down, the good constellation therefore went to the corpse and said, 'Jyoti!

source_sentence: 汝命終耶？』
translation: Will your life end?'

source_sentence: 死屍答言：『我已命終。』
translation: The corpse replied, 'I've reached the end of my life.'

source_sentence: 問曰：『汝以何患命終？』
translation: He asked, 'What's the reason you've ended up dead?'

source_sentence: 死屍答言：『瞿曇記我，七日後腹脹命終，我如其言，至滿七日，腹脹命終。』
translation: The corpse replied, 'The Gautama remembered that I would die with a distended belly after seven days, and I did as he said until the seventh day had passed and my belly was distended and I died.'

source_sentence: 善宿復問：『汝生何處？』
translation: Again, the good constellation asked, 'Where were you born?'

source_sentence: 屍即報言：『彼瞿曇所記，當生起屍餓鬼中，我今日生起屍餓鬼中。』
translation: The corpse then reported, 'He was told by the Gautama that he would be born among corpses and hungry ghosts, and today I've been born among corpses and hungry ghosts.'

source_sentence: 善宿問曰：『汝命終時，云何殯送？』
translation: The good constellation asked, 'When your life ends, how will you be funeralized?'

source_sentence: 屍答曰：『瞿曇所記，以葦索繫抴於塚間，實如彼言，以葦索繫抴於塚間。』
translation: The corpse answered, 'Gautama's account of tying a reed rope around a tomb is true, just as he said, 'Tying a reed rope around a tomb.'

source_sentence: 時，死屍語善宿曰：『汝雖出家，不得善利。
translation: The corpse then said to Sunjū, 'Even though you left home, you couldn't get any good benefits.

source_sentence: 瞿曇沙門說如此事，汝常不信。』
translation: You've always disbelieved such things as those taught by the Gautama ascetics.'

source_sentence: 作是語已，死屍還臥。
translation: After he said that, the corpse returned to his bed.

source_sentence: 「梵志！
translation: "Brahmā!

source_sentence: 時，善宿比丘來至我所，頭面禮足，在一面坐，不以此緣語我，我尋語曰：『如我所記，究羅帝者實爾以不？』
translation: When the monk Sunjū came to me, paid homage with his head and feet, and sat to one side, he didn't say anything to me about this, so I asked, 'Is it true, as I've recorded, that the monk Jyoti is not?'

source_sentence: 答曰：『實爾，如世尊言。』
translation: He answered, 'Indeed, just as the Bhagavān said.'

source_sentence: 梵志！
translation: Brahmā!

source_sentence: 我如是數數為善宿比丘現神通證，而彼猶言：『世尊不為我現神通。』」
translation: Thus have I repeatedly demonstrated supernormal powers for the monks of Shansui, but they still say, 'The Bhagavān doesn't give me supernormal powers.'"

source_sentence: 佛告梵志：「我於一時在獼猴池法講堂上，時有梵志，名曰波梨子，在彼處止，人所宗敬，名稱遠聞，多有利養，於毘舍離大眾之中，作如是說：『沙門瞿曇自稱智慧，我亦智慧；沙門瞿曇自稱神足，我亦有神足；沙門瞿曇得超越道，我亦得超越道。
translation: The Buddha told the priest, "One time, I was in the Dharma discussion hall at Monkey Lake when a priest named Pārijāta, who was staying there, was revered by people, was well-known, and had many benefits, said this among the Vaiśālī community, 'The ascetic Gautama claims to be wise, and I am wise; the ascetic Gautama claims to have spiritual powers, and I have spiritual powers; the ascetic Gautama has transcended the path, and I have transcended the path.

source_sentence: 我當與彼共現神足，沙門現一，我當現二；沙門現二，我當現四；沙門現八，我現十六；沙門現十六，我現三十二；沙門現三十二，我現六十四。
translation: I will share with them their miraculous abilities; when an ascetic shows one, I'll show two; when an ascetic shows two, I'll show four; when an ascetic shows eight, I'll now show 16; when an ascetic shows 16, I'll now show 32; and when an ascetic shows 32, I'll now show 64.

source_sentence: 隨彼沙門所現多少，我盡當倍。』
translation: However many of those ascetics appear, I will multiply them as many times as I can.'

source_sentence: 「梵志！
translation: "Brahmā!

source_sentence: 時，善宿比丘著衣持鉢，入城乞食，見波梨梵志於大眾中作如是說：『沙門瞿曇自稱智慧，我亦智慧；沙門瞿曇自稱神足，我亦有神足；沙門瞿曇得超越道，我亦得超越道。
translation: The monk Sunsuke was dressed in robes and carrying a bowl when he entered the city to solicit alms and saw the priest Pāli in the crowd saying, 'The ascetic Gautama claims to be wise, and I am wise; the ascetic Gautama claims to be miraculous, and I am miraculous; the ascetic Gautama has transcended the path, and I have transcended the path.

source_sentence: 我當與彼共現神足，沙門現一，我當現二；沙門現四，我當現八；乃至隨沙門所現多少，我盡能倍。』
translation: I will share with them their spiritual abilities; as an ascetic shows one, I'll show two; as an ascetic shows four, I'll show eight; and as many as an ascetic shows, I'll be able to multiply them.'

source_sentence: 時，善宿比丘乞食已，來至我所，頭面禮，一面坐，語我言：『我於晨朝著衣持鉢，入城乞食，時，聞毘舍離波梨子於大眾中作是說言：沙門瞿曇有大智慧，我亦有大智慧；沙門瞿曇有神足，我亦有神足；瞿曇現一，我當現二；乃至隨瞿曇所現多少，我盡能倍。』
translation: When the monk Sunsuke came to me after soliciting alms, he bowed his head, sat to one side, and said to me, 'In the early morning, as I was putting on my robe and carrying my bowl and going into town to solicit alms, I heard Vaiśālī Pārśvaṇa say this among the crowd, 'The ascetic Gautama has great wisdom, and I have great wisdom; the ascetic Gautama has miraculous powers, and I have miraculous powers; the Gautama shows one, and I will show two; up to the extent that I can multiply whatever the Gautama shows, I will be able to do so.'

source_sentence: 具以此事而來告我，我語善宿言：『彼波梨子於大眾中不捨此語，不捨此見，不捨此慢，來至我所者，終無是處。
translation: When this was fully explained to me, I told Sunjū, 'That Pārśva doesn't abandon this speech, doesn't abandon this view, and doesn't abandon this conceit in the midst of the crowd, and he comes to me, but there's no place for him.

source_sentence: 若彼作是念：我不捨此語，不捨此見，不捨此慢，而至沙門瞿曇所者，彼頭即當破為七分。
translation: If he thinks, 'I won't abandon this speech, I won't abandon this view, and I won't abandon this conceit, and I come to the ascetic Gautama, his head will be broken into seven parts.'

source_sentence: 欲使彼人不捨此語，不捨見慢，而能來者，無有是處。』
translation: There's no place for someone who wants to come without abandoning this speech and without abandoning views and conceit.'

source_sentence: 「善宿言：『世尊護口，如來護口。』
translation: "Sunjū said, 'The Bhagavān guards his mouth, and the Tathāgata guards his mouth.'

source_sentence: 佛告善宿：『汝何故言：世尊護口，如來護口？』
translation: The Buddha told Shansuo, 'Why do you say, 'The Bhagavān guards his mouth, and the Tathāgata guards it?'

source_sentence: 善宿言：『彼波梨子有大威神，有大德力，脫當來者將無現世尊虛耶？』
translation: The good constellation said, 'Does he, Pārśva, have great authority and virtue, and will he not have a present world-honored one in the future?'

source_sentence: 佛告善宿：『如來所言頗有二耶？』
translation: The Buddha told Sun-Suk, 'Does the Tathāgata say that there are two?'

source_sentence: 對曰：『無也。』
translation: He said, 'No.'

source_sentence: 又告善宿：『若無二者，汝何故言：世尊護口，如來護口？』
translation: Again, he told Shansui, 'If there are no two, why do you say, 'The Bhagavān guards his mouth, and the Tathāgata guards his mouth?'

source_sentence: 善宿白佛言：『世尊為自知見彼波梨子，為諸天來語。』
translation: The good constellation said to the Buddha, 'Bhagavān, you know that you've seen him, Pārīputra, and you've spoken to him from the gods.'

source_sentence: 佛言：『我亦自知，亦諸天來語故知，此毘舍離阿由大將，身壞命終，生忉利天。
translation: The Buddha said, 'I also know, and I know because of what the gods have told me, that this Ayodhyā general from Vaiśālī was born in the Heaven of Thirty-three when his body broke up and his life ended.

source_sentence: 彼來語我言：波梨梵志子不知羞慚，犯戒妄語，在毘舍離，於大眾中作如是誹謗言，阿由陀大將身壞命終，生起屍鬼中，然我實身壞命終，生忉利天。
translation: They said to me, 'Bālī Brahmā didn't know shame, violated the precepts, and spoke falsely, and he said in Vaiśālī that he had denigrated the general Āyurveda and was born among corpses when his body broke up and died, but I was really born in the Heaven of Tragedy when my body broke up and died.'

source_sentence: 波梨子我先自知，亦諸天來語故知。』
translation: Pārśva knew this on my own, and I knew it because the gods told me so.'

source_sentence: 佛告愚人善宿：『汝不信我言者，入毘舍離，隨汝唱之，我食後當往詣波梨梵志子所。』」
translation: The Buddha told the foolish man Sunjū, 'If you don't believe my words, go into Vaiśālī and tell them as you like; after I eat, I'll go to Parītta and visit Brahmā.'"

source_sentence: 佛告梵志：「時，彼善宿過其夜已，著衣持鉢，入城乞食。
translation: The Buddha told the priest, "After the night passed, that good lodger put on his robe and took his bowl into the city to solicit alms.

source_sentence: 時，彼善宿向毘舍離城中眾多婆羅門、沙門、梵志，具說此言：『波梨梵志子於大眾中說如此言：沙門瞿曇有大智慧，我亦有大智慧；沙門瞿曇有大威力，我亦有大威力；沙門瞿曇有大神足，我亦有大神足；沙門現一，我當現二；乃至沙門隨所現多少，我盡當倍。
translation: That good lodger then addressed a large crowd of brāhmaṇas, ascetics, and priests in Vaiśālī, saying, 'This is what the son of Pāli said to the crowd: 'The ascetic Gautama has great wisdom, and I have great wisdom; the ascetic Gautama has great power, and I have great power; the ascetic Gautama has great spiritual powers, and I have great spiritual powers; the ascetic shows one, and I will show two; and whatever the ascetic shows, I will multiply it.'

source_sentence: 而今沙門瞿曇欲詣彼波梨子所，汝等眾人盡可詣彼。』
translation: Now, if the ascetic Gautama wants to go to that Parītta, you people can go there as often as you like.'

source_sentence: 時，波梨梵志在道而行，善宿見已，速詣其所，語言：『汝於毘舍離大眾中作如是言，沙門瞿曇有大智慧，我亦有大智慧，乃至沙門瞿曇，隨所現神足多少，我盡當倍。
translation: When the priest Pārī was walking along the path, the good constellation saw him and quickly went to him, saying, 'You said this among the Vaiśālī community, 'The ascetic Gautama has great wisdom, and I also have great wisdom; up to the point that the ascetic Gautama will display as many spiritual powers as I have, I will double them.'

source_sentence: 瞿曇聞此言，今欲來至汝所，汝可速歸。』
translation: Now, when the Gautama hears this, he wants to come to you, so you may quickly return.'

source_sentence: 報言：『我當歸耳！
translation: He replied, 'I will return!'

source_sentence: 我當歸耳！』
translation: I will return to my ears!'

source_sentence: 作此語已，尋自惶懼，衣毛為竪，不還本處，乃詣道頭波梨梵志林中，坐繩床上，愁悶迷亂。」
translation: After he said this, he looked himself in fear, his clothes stood on end, and his hair stood on end. He didn't return to his original place, but went to the Brahmā's grove at Daotou Parī, sat on a rope bed, and became sad and confused."

source_sentence: 佛告梵志：「我於食後與眾多隸車、沙門、婆羅門、梵志、居士詣波梨子住處，就座而坐。
translation: The Buddha told the priest, "After we ate, I went to Pārśva's dwelling with a large group of charioteers, ascetics, priests, householders, and priests, and sat down at my seat.

source_sentence: 於彼眾中有梵志名曰遮羅，時，眾人喚彼遮羅而告之曰：『汝詣道頭林中語波梨子言：「今眾多隸車、沙門、婆羅門、梵志、居士盡集汝林，眾共議言：『梵志波梨於大眾中自唱此言：「沙門瞿曇有大智慧，我亦有大智慧，乃至瞿曇隨現神足多少，我盡能倍。」
translation: Among them was a priest named Cālaka, who was then summoned by the crowd and told Cālaka, 'Go into the forest of Daotou and tell Pārīpaṇḍa, 'Now, many chariots, ascetics, priests, priests, and laymen have gathered in your forest, and the crowd is conversing, saying, 'Pārīpaṇḍa, the priest, said this to the crowd, 'The ascetic Gautama has great wisdom, and I also have great wisdom, even to the extent that I can duplicate as many of the Gautama's miraculous powers as he shows.'"

source_sentence: 沙門瞿曇故來至汝林中，汝可來看。』」』
translation: The ascetic Gautama has therefore come to your forest, so you may come and see it."'"

source_sentence: 於是，遮羅聞眾人語已，即詣道頭林語波梨子言：『彼眾多隸車、沙門、婆羅門、梵志、居士盡集在汝林，眾共議言：「梵志波梨子於大眾中自唱此言：『沙門瞿曇有大智慧，我亦有大智慧，乃至沙門瞿曇現神足，隨現多少，我盡能倍。』
translation: After hearing what they said, Cāla went to the forest of Daotou and said to Pārśva, 'Many of those lions, ascetics, priests, brāhmaṇas, and householders are gathered in your forest, and the people all agreed, saying, 'Pārśva taught himself this, saying, 'The ascetic Gautama has great wisdom; I also have great wisdom; even the ascetic Gautama shows miraculous powers, and I can multiply them as many times as he shows them.'

source_sentence: 瞿曇今在彼林中，波梨今者寧可還也。」』
translation: Now that the Gautama is in that forest, Pārśva would rather return now.'"

source_sentence: 爾時，波梨梵志即報遮羅曰：『當歸！
translation: It was then that the priest Pārśva reported to Cālā, 'You must return!'

source_sentence: 當歸！』
translation: will return!'

source_sentence: 作是語已，於繩床上轉側不安。
translation: After saying this, he turned to his side on the rope-bed and became restless.

source_sentence: 爾時，繩床復著其足，彼乃不能得離繩床，況能行步至世尊所？
translation: At that point, the rope-bed again caught his foot, and he couldn't get off the rope-bed, so how could he walk to the Bhagavān?

source_sentence: 「時，遮羅語波梨言：『汝自無智，但有空聲為言：「當歸！
translation: "Then, Cāla said to Pāli, 'You yourself lack knowledge, but you simply make empty noises and say, 'I will return!'

source_sentence: 當歸！」
translation: will return!"

source_sentence: 尚自不能離此繩床，何由能得至大眾所？』
translation: How can one reach the masses when one is still unable to part with this rope-bottomed rope?'

source_sentence: 呵責波梨子已，即還詣大眾所，報言：『我以持眾人聲，往語波梨子，彼報我言：「當歸！
translation: After rebuking Pārśva, he went back to the crowd and reported, 'I spoke to Pārśva with the sound of a multitude of voices, and he told me, 'I will return!'

source_sentence: 當歸！」
translation: will return!"

source_sentence: 即於繩床上動轉其身，床即著足不能得離，彼尚不能離其繩床，何由能得來到此眾？』
translation: He then moves his body on the rope-bed, and the bed catches his footing and he can't get away from it. How could he come to this crowd if he couldn't yet get away from the rope-bed?'

source_sentence: 爾時，有一頭摩隸車子在眾中坐，即從座起，偏露右臂，長跪叉手，白彼眾言：『大眾小待，我今自往將彼人來。』」
translation: At the time, a certain Dharmagupta rose from his seat while he was sitting among the crowd, bared his right arm, knelt down with his palms together, and said to the crowd, 'Stand by, people! I'm going to bring that person here myself.'"

source_sentence: 佛言：「我爾時語頭摩隸車子言：『彼人作如是語，懷如是見，起如是慢，欲使此人來至佛所，無有是處。
translation: The Buddha said, "At the time, I said to Dharmarakṣa, 'That person made such a statement, harbored such a view, and became so conceited that he wanted to bring that person to the Buddha, but there's no place for him.'

source_sentence: 頭摩子！
translation: Dharmakṣema!

source_sentence: 正使汝以革繩重繫，群牛共挽，至彼身碎，彼終不能捨如是語、如是見、如是慢，來至我所。
translation: Just when you've tied a leather rope around him and a herd of oxen is pulling him until he's broken, he can't abandon such words, such views, and such conceit and come to me.

source_sentence: 若不信我言，汝往自知。』
translation: If you don't believe my words, you'll know for yourself when you go there.'

source_sentence: 爾時，頭摩隷車子故往至波梨子所，語波梨子言：『眾多隸車、沙門、婆羅門、梵志、居士盡集汝林，眾共議言：「梵志波梨子於大眾中口自唱言：『沙門瞿曇有大智慧，我亦有大智慧乃至沙門瞿曇現其神足，隨所現多少，我盡能倍。』
translation: It was then that Dharmakṣema went to Pārśva and said to him, 'Many charioteers, ascetics, priests, religious practitioners, and laymen have gathered in your forest, and they all say, 'Pārśva, the priest, is singing to himself, saying, 'The ascetic Gautama has great wisdom, and I also have great wisdom up to the point where the ascetic Gautama shows his spiritual powers, and I can multiply them as many times as he shows them.'

source_sentence: 瞿曇沙門今在彼林，汝可還歸。」』
translation: The ascetic Gautama is now in that forest; you may return."

source_sentence: 爾時，波梨子即報言：『當歸！
translation: It was then that Pārśva replied, 'I will return!'

source_sentence: 當歸！』
translation: will return!'

source_sentence: 作是語已，於繩床上動轉其身，爾時繩床復著其足，彼乃不能自離繩床，況復行步至世尊所？
translation: After saying this, he moved his body around on the rope-bed, and then the rope-bed again caught his feet, so he couldn't get off the rope-bed by himself, how could he walk to the Bhagavān?

source_sentence: 「時，頭摩語波梨子言：『汝自無智，但有空聲為言：「當歸！
translation: "Śākyamuni then spoke to Pārśva, saying, 'You yourself lack knowledge, but you simply make empty noises and say, 'I will return!'

source_sentence: 當歸！」
translation: will return!"

source_sentence: 尚自不能離此繩床，何由能得至大眾所？』
translation: How can one reach the masses when one is still unable to part with this rope-bottomed rope?'

source_sentence: 頭摩復語波梨子曰：『諸有智者，以譬喻得解，乃往久遠有一師子獸王在深林中住，師子清旦初出窟時，四向顧望，奮迅三吼，然後遊行擇肉而食。
translation: Dharma also told Pārśva, "All you wise people who have understood by parables have long since gone to a place where a lion king of beasts lives in a deep forest. When the lion first emerges from his cave at sunrise, he looks around, rushes around, roars three times, and then wanders off to choose meat and eat it.

source_sentence: 波梨子！
translation: Pārśva!

source_sentence: 彼師子獸王食已還林，常有一野干隨後食殘，氣力充足便自言：「彼林師子竟是何獸？
translation: After he had eaten, that lion king returned to the forest, but there was always a wild dry animal that followed him and left him with enough energy to say to himself, "What kind of animal is that lion king of the forest?

source_sentence: 能勝我耶？

source_sentence: 今寧可獨擅一林，清旦出窟，四向顧望，奮迅三吼，然後遊行，擇肉而食耶！」
translation: How could he leave his cave alone, go out in the early morning, look around, roar three times, and then march off to choose meat to eat?"

source_sentence: 彼尋獨處一林，清旦出窟，奮迅三吼，然後遊行，欲師子吼，作野干鳴。
translation: Seeking to find himself alone in a forest, he emerges from his cave at sunrise, rushes out with three roars, then marches off, desiring a lion's roar, and makes a wild, dry cry.

source_sentence: 時，頭摩子以偈責數曰：「『野干稱師子，　　自謂為獸王；　　欲作師子吼，　　還出野干聲。
translation: Śākyamuni then rebuked them with a verse, saying, "Nāgasena calls himself the lion, and he calls himself the king of animals; when he wants to make the lion's roar, he makes Nāgasena's voice again.

source_sentence: 獨處於空林，　　自謂為獸王；　　欲作師子吼，　　還出野干聲。

translation: They kneel down and look for a mouse in a cave, or they search through a tomb for a dead corpse; they want to make a lion's roar, but they make a wild, dry sound.'

source_sentence: 「頭摩子告曰：『汝亦如是，蒙佛恩力，存生於世，得人供養，而今更與如來共競。』
translation: "Rāṣṭrapāla told him, 'So it is with the Tathāgata that you, too, have been endowed by the Buddha's grace with birth in this world and have received offerings from people, and now you're competing with the Tathāgata.'

source_sentence: 時，彼頭摩子以四種喻，面呵責已，還詣大眾，報言：『我以持眾人聲喚波梨子，彼報我言：「當歸！
translation: After he had been personally rebuked with four metaphors, he returned to the crowd and reported, 'I called Pārśva with the sound of a multitude of people, and he told me, 'You must return!'

source_sentence: 即於繩床上動轉其身，床即著足不能得離；彼尚不能自離繩床何由能得來到此眾？』
translation: He then moves his body on the rope-bed, and the bed catches his footing and he can't get off; how could he come to this crowd if he can't get off the rope-bed by himself?'

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊告頭摩子言：『我先語汝，欲使此人來至佛所，無有是處。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed Śākyamuni, saying, 'I first told you that I wanted to get this person to come to the Buddha, but there's no place for them.

source_sentence: 正使汝以革繩重繫，群牛共挽，至身碎壞，彼終不肯捨如是語、如是見、慢，來至我所。』
translation: Just when you've tied him up with a heavy leather rope and a herd of oxen, he'll be pulled along until his body is broken, but he still refuses to abandon such words, such views, and such conceit and come to me.'

source_sentence: 梵志！
translation: Brahmā!

source_sentence: 時，我即與彼大眾種種說法，示教利喜，於彼眾中三師子吼，身昇虛空，還詣本處。」
translation: Thereupon, I spoke to that crowd in various ways, showed them the benefits of my teachings, roared three times as a lion among them, ascended into space, and returned to my original place."

source_sentence: 佛告梵志：「或有沙門、婆羅門言：『一切世間，梵自在天所造。』
translation: The Buddha told Brahmā, "Perhaps there are ascetics or priests who say, 'All the world is made by the Brahmā Saṃbhavā Heaven.'

source_sentence: 我問彼言：『一切世間實梵自在天所造耶？』
translation: I asked them, 'Are all the worlds really made by Brahmā's own gods?'

source_sentence: 彼不能報，還問我言：『瞿曇！
translation: Unable to respond, they also asked me, 'Gautama!

source_sentence: 此事云何？』
translation: What is this?'

source_sentence: 我報彼言：『或有此世間初壞敗時，有餘眾生命盡行盡，從光音天命終乃更生餘空梵處；於彼起愛，生樂著心，復欲使餘眾生來生此處，其餘眾生命盡行盡，復生彼處。』
translation: I replied to them, 'Perhaps there was a time when this world first decayed and some other sentient beings' lives were ended and their actions were terminated, and they were reborn in some other Brahma place of emptiness after their lives ended in the Luminous Sound Heaven; they became attached to that, and they became happy and attached to it, wanting to cause other sentient beings to be born here, and the remaining sentient beings' lives were ended and their actions were terminated, and they were born there again.'

source_sentence: 時，彼眾生自作是念：『我今是大梵王，忽然而有，無作我者；我能盡達諸義所趣，於千世界最得自在；能作能化，微妙第一，為人父母。
translation: That sentient being then thought to himself, 'Now, I'm the great Brahma king who suddenly existed, who didn't make myself; I can fully understand all the meanings and destinies, and I'm the most comfortable in a thousand worlds; I'm the most subtle and effective in creating and teaching, and I'm the father and mother of people.

source_sentence: 我先至此，獨一無侶，由我力故，有此眾生，我作此眾生；彼餘眾生亦復順從，稱為梵王，忽然而有，盡達諸義，於千世界最得自在，能作能化，微妙第一，為人父母，先有是一，後有我等，此大梵王化作我等。
translation: I came here first, alone and without a partner, and because of my power, these sentient beings existed, and I created them; the other sentient beings also complied, and they were called Brahmā Kings, who suddenly appeared, fully comprehended all doctrines, attained the greatest ease in a thousand worlds, were able to work and teach, were the most subtle, and were the parents of people, and first there was this one, and then there were we, the great Brahmā Kings, who created us.

source_sentence: 此諸眾生隨彼壽終來生此間，其漸長大，剃除鬚髮，服三法衣，出家為道。
translation: These sentient beings are born here at the end of their lives, gradually grow up, shave off their hair, put on the three dharma robes, and leave home to follow the path.

source_sentence: 彼入定意三昧，隨三昧心憶本所生，彼作是語：此大梵天忽然而有，無有作者，盡達諸義，於千世界最得自在，能作能化，微妙第一，為人父母。
translation: They enter the samādhi of concentration and mind, and as they remember what was originally born in that samādhi, they say, "This great brahma god suddenly appeared, has no author, fully comprehends all meanings, is the most at ease in a thousand worlds, is capable of doing and teaching, is the most subtle, and is the father and mother of humans.

source_sentence: 彼大梵天常住不移，無變易法，我等梵天所化，是以無常，不得久住，為變易法。』
translation: That great brahma god is eternally abiding and immutable, with no changing dharmas, and what we brahma gods create is therefore impermanent, can't stand for long, and is a changing dharma.'

source_sentence: 如是，梵志！
translation: So it is, Brahmā!

source_sentence: 彼沙門、婆羅門以此緣故，各言彼梵自在天造此世界。
translation: For this reason, those ascetics and brāhmaṇas each said that Brahmā Saṃpati had created this world.

source_sentence: 梵志！
translation: Brahmā!

source_sentence: 造此世界者，非彼所及，唯佛能知。
translation: The one who made this world is beyond their reach; only the Buddha can know it.

source_sentence: 又過此事，佛亦盡知，雖知不著苦、集、滅、味、過、出要，如實知之，以平等觀無餘解脫，名曰如來。」
translation: The Buddha also knows all of the past, even though he knows it without attachment to the essentials of suffering, arising, cessation, taste, error, and escape, and knows it as it really is, and he observes liberation without remainder with equality, which is called the Tathāgata."

source_sentence: 佛告梵志：「或有沙門、婆羅門作是言：『戱笑懈怠是眾生始。』
translation: The Buddha told the Brahmā, "Perhaps there are ascetics or priests who say, 'Drama and laziness are the first causes of sentient beings.'

source_sentence: 我語彼言：『云何汝等實言，戱笑懈怠是眾生始耶？』
translation: I said to them, 'How do you really say that drama, laughter, and laziness are the beginning of sentient beings?'

source_sentence: 彼不能報，逆問我言：『瞿曇！
translation: Unable to respond, they rebelliously asked me, 'Gautama!

source_sentence: 此事云何？』
translation: What is this?'

source_sentence: 時我報言：『或有光音眾生喜戱笑懈怠，身壞命終，來生此間，漸漸長大，剃除鬚髮，服三法衣，出家修道，便入心定三昧，以三昧力識本所生，便作是言：彼餘眾生不喜戱笑，常在彼處，永住不變；由我等數喜戱笑，致此無常，為變易法。』
translation: I then reported, 'Perhaps some luminous-voice sentient beings who are prone to drama and laziness and whose bodies perish and whose lives end come to be born here, gradually grow up, shave off their hair, put on the three dharma robes, leave home, and train, then enter the concentration of mind, and with the power of concentration they realize what was originally produced. They then say, "Those other sentient beings aren't prone to drama and laziness, but they're always there, always abiding, and unchanging; it's because we are so prone to drama and laughter that this is impermanent and liable to change."

source_sentence: 如是，梵志！
translation: So it is, Brahmā!

source_sentence: 彼沙門、婆羅門以是緣故，言戱笑是眾生始，如是佛盡知之，過是亦知，知而不著，已不著苦、集、滅、味、過、出要，如實知之，已平等觀無餘解脫，名曰如來。」
translation: It's for this reason that those ascetics and priests say that the beginnings of sentient beings are drama and laughter; thus, the Buddha knows it completely and knows the past as well, knows it without attachment, doesn't attach to it anymore, doesn't attach to the essentials of suffering, arising, cessation, taste, error, and escape, and knows it as it is; he has equally contemplated liberation without remainder and is called the Tathāgata."

source_sentence: 佛告梵志：「或有沙門、婆羅門言：『失意是眾生始。』
translation: The Buddha told the Brahmā, "Perhaps there are ascetics or priests who say, 'Loss of mindfulness is the beginning of sentient beings.'

source_sentence: 我語彼言：『汝等實言：失意是眾生始耶？』
translation: I said to them, 'Do you really say, 'Loss of mind is the beginning of sentient beings?'

source_sentence: 彼不知報，還問我言：『瞿曇！
translation: Not knowing the reward, they still asked me, 'Gautama!

source_sentence: 此事云何？』
translation: What is this?'

source_sentence: 我語彼言：『或有眾生展轉相看已，便失意，由是命終，來生此間，漸漸長大，剃除鬚髮，服三法衣，出家修道，便入心定三昧，以三昧力識本所生，便作是言：如彼眾生以不展轉相看，不失意故，常住不變；我等於彼數數相看已，便失意，致此無常，為變易法。』
translation: I told them, 'Perhaps there's a sentient being who loses their mind after looking at each other repeatedly, and then, after their life ends, they're born here, gradually grow up, shave off their hair, put on the three dharma robes, leave home, train, and then enter the concentration samādhi of mind; with the power of samādhi, they realize what was originally produced, and then they say, 'Such a sentient being is permanent and unchanging because they don't look at each other repeatedly and don't lose their mind; after we look at them several times, we lose our minds, which makes them impermanent and liable to change.'

source_sentence: 如是，梵志！
translation: So it is, Brahmā!

source_sentence: 彼沙門、婆羅門以是緣故，言失意是眾生始，如此唯佛知之，過是亦知，知已不著苦、集、滅、味、過、出要，如實知之，知已平等觀無餘解脫，故名如來。」
translation: It's for this reason that those ascetics and priests say that loss of mind is the beginning of sentient beings; only the Buddha knows this, and he knows the error as well; once he knows it, he doesn't attach to the essentials of suffering, arising, cessation, taste, error, and escape; he knows it as it is; once he knows it, he observes liberation without remainder equally; therefore, he's called a tathāgata."

source_sentence: 佛告梵志：「或有沙門、婆羅門言：『我無因而出。』
translation: The Buddha told the Brahmā, "Perhaps there's an ascetic or a brāhmaṇa who says, 'There's no way I can escape.'

source_sentence: 我語彼言：『汝等實言：本無因出耶？』
translation: I said to them, 'Do you really say, 'I came out without a cause?'

source_sentence: 彼不能報，逆來問我，我時報曰：『或有眾生無想無知，若彼眾生起想，則便命終來生此間，漸漸長大，剃除鬚髮，服三法衣，出家修道，便入心定三昧，以三昧力識本所生，便作是言：我本無有，今忽然有；此世間本無，今有，此實餘虛。』
translation: Being unable to respond, they rebelliously came to me and asked, 'I then replied, 'Perhaps there are sentient beings who lack perception and ignorance, but if they give rise to perception, then they will be born here at the end of their lives, gradually grow up, shave off their hair, put on the three dharma robes, leave home and train, then enter the concentration and samādhi of mind, and with the power of samādhi they'll realize what was originally born and then say, 'I was originally nonexistent, but now I suddenly exist; this world was originally nonexistent, but now it exists, and the rest of it is really unreal.'

source_sentence: 如是，梵志！
translation: So it is, Brahmā!

source_sentence: 沙門、婆羅門以此緣故，言無因出，唯佛知之，過是亦知，知已不著苦、集、滅、味、過、出要，如實知之，已平等觀無餘解脫，故名如來。」
translation: For this reason, ascetics and priests say that there's no cause for their escape, but the Buddha alone knows it, and he also knows the error after knowing it; he doesn't attach to the essentials of suffering, arising, cessation, taste, error, and escape; he knows them as they really are and has equally contemplated liberation without remainder; therefore, he's called a tathāgata."

source_sentence: 佛告梵志：「我所說如是，或有沙門、婆羅門於屏處誹謗我言：『沙門瞿曇自稱弟子入淨解脫，成就淨行，彼知清淨，不遍知淨。』
translation: The Buddha told the Brahmā, "Thus I have explained, but some ascetics or priests may denigrate me in a secluded place, saying, 'The ascetic Gautama claims that his disciple has entered pure liberation and accomplished pure practices; he knows that they're pure but doesn't know that they're pure altogether.'

source_sentence: 然我不作是說：『我弟子入淨解脫，成就淨行，彼知清淨，不遍知淨。』
translation: Still, I don't say this, 'My disciple has entered pure liberation and accomplished pure practices, and he knows that they're pure but doesn't know that they're pure universally.'

source_sentence: 梵志！
translation: Brahmā!

source_sentence: 我自言：『我弟子入淨解脫，成就淨行，彼知清淨，一切遍淨。』」
translation: I said to myself, 'My disciple has entered into pure liberation and accomplished pure practices, and he knows that they are pure and that everything is pervasively pure.'"

source_sentence: 是時，梵志白佛言：「彼不得善利，毀謗沙門瞿曇言：『沙門自言：「我弟子入淨解脫，成就淨行，彼知清淨，不遍知淨。」』
translation: The priest then said to the Buddha, "They don't obtain good benefits and denigrate the ascetic Gautama, saying, 'The ascetic says, 'My disciple has entered pure liberation and accomplished pure practices, and he knows that they are pure and doesn't know that they are pure everywhere.'

source_sentence: 然世尊不作是語，世尊自言：『我弟子入淨解脫，成就淨行，彼知清淨，一切遍淨。』」
translation: However, the Bhagavān didn't say that. The Bhagavān said to himself, 'My disciple has entered pure liberation and accomplished pure practices, and he knows that they are pure and that everything is pervasively pure.'

source_sentence: 又白佛言：「我亦當入此淨解脫，成就淨行，一切遍知。」
translation: He also said to the Buddha, "I, too, will enter into this pure liberation, accomplishing pure practices and pervasive knowledge of everything."

source_sentence: 佛告梵志：「汝欲入者，甚為難也。
translation: The Buddha told the priest, "It's very difficult for you to want to enter it.

source_sentence: 汝見異、忍異、行異，欲依餘見入淨解脫者，難可得也；但使汝好樂佛，心不斷絕者，則於長夜，常得安樂。」
translation: If your views, tolerances, and practices are different, and you want to rely on other views to enter pure liberation, it's difficult to attain them; but if you delight in the Buddha and don't stop at one point, then you'll always be at ease during long nights."

source_sentence: 爾時，房伽婆梵志聞佛所說，歡喜奉行。
translation: It was then that the Vajra of Phāngava heard what the Buddha taught, rejoiced, and approved.

translation: (16) The Buddha's Exposition of the Second Part of the Longer Āgama: The Twelfth Sutra on Good Birth

source_sentence: 如是我聞：一時，佛在羅閱祇耆闍崛山中，與大比丘眾千二百五十人俱。
translation: Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was in the Gṛdhrakūṭa mountains of Rājagṛha with a large assembly of 1,250 monks.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊時到著衣持鉢，入城乞食。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān arrived, put on his robe and took his bowl into the city to solicit alms.

source_sentence: 時，羅閱祇城內有長者子，名曰善生，清旦出城，詣園遊觀，初沐浴訖，舉身皆濕，向諸方禮，東、西、南、北、上、下諸方，皆悉周遍。
translation: At the time, an elder named Shangsheng from Rājagṛha left the city at sunrise, went to the park to look around, and after his first bath, he got his body wet and paid homage to all directions, covering them all from east, west, south, north, up, and down.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊見長者子善生詣園遊觀，初沐浴訖，舉身皆濕，向諸方禮。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān saw the elder son Sun Sang go to the park to take a tour, and after he had first bathed, he lifted his body, which was wet, and paid homage to all directions.

source_sentence: 世尊見已，即詣其所，告善生言：「汝以何緣，清旦出城，於園林中，舉身皆濕，向諸方禮？」
translation: After he saw this, the Bhagavān went to him and told Sun Sang, "For what reason did you leave town at sunrise and go out into the park and forest, lifting your body to get wet and paying homage to various directions?"

source_sentence: 爾時，善生白佛言：「我父臨命終時，遺勅我言：『汝欲禮者，當先禮東方、南方、西方、北方、上方、下方。』
translation: It was then that Sunāṅga said to the Buddha, "When my father was about to die, he told me, 'If you want to pay homage, first pay homage to the east, south, west, north, above, and below.'

source_sentence: 我奉承父教不敢違背，故澡浴訖，先叉手東面，向東方禮；南、西、北方，上、下諸方，皆悉周遍。」
translation: I obeyed my father's instruction and didn't dare to disobey it, so when I finished bathing, I first saluted the east with my palms together, and then I saluted the south, west, north, and the upper and lower directions."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊告善生曰：「長者子！
translation: The Bhagavān then addressed Sun Sang, "Elder son!

source_sentence: 有此方名耳，非為不有；然我賢聖法中，非禮此六方以為恭敬。」
translation: It's not that there's a name for this direction that doesn't exist, but in my noble teaching, I don't venerate these six directions in order to respect them."

source_sentence: 善生白佛言：「唯願世尊善為我說賢聖法中禮六方法！」
translation: Sun Sang said to the Buddha, "Please, Bhagavān, be so kind as to explain to me the six ways of venerating the noble Dharma!"

source_sentence: 佛告長者子：「諦聽！
translation: The Buddha told the son of Nagarjuna, "Listen closely!

source_sentence: 諦聽！
translation: Listen closely!

source_sentence: 善思念之，當為汝說。」
translation: Consider it well, and I will explain it for you."

source_sentence: 善生對曰：「唯然，願樂欲聞！」
translation: The good student replied, "Yes, I'd like to hear about it!"

source_sentence: 佛告善生：「若長者、長者子知四結業不於四處而作惡行，又復能知六損財業，是謂，善生！
translation: The Buddha told Sangsheng, "Suppose an elder or an elder son knows the four binding activities and doesn't engage in bad behavior in the four places, and he can also know the six damaging karmas, this is called, 'Sangsheng!'

source_sentence: 長者、長者子離四惡行，禮敬六方。
translation: "An elder and an elder's son part with the four bad deeds and venerate the six directions.

source_sentence: 今世亦善，後獲善報，今世根基，後世根基，於現法中，智者所稱，獲世一果，身壞命終，生天、善處。
translation: They are also good in this life, attain good rewards in the future, have the roots of this life and the roots of the latter life, attain the one worldly fruit in the present as called for by wise men, and are born in a heaven or a good place when their bodies break up and their lives end.

source_sentence: 善生！
translation: Good birth!

source_sentence: 當知四結行者：一者殺生，二者盜竊，三者婬逸，四者妄語，是四結行。
translation: You should know the four binding practices: one is killing, two is stealing, three is lust, and four is false speech.

source_sentence: 云何為四處？
translation: What are the four abodes?

source_sentence: 一者欲，二者恚，三者怖，四者癡。
translation: One is desire, two are anger, three are fear, and four are delusion.

source_sentence: 若長者、長者子於此四處而作惡者，則有損耗。」
translation: If an elder or an elder's son does evil in these four places, it will damage them."

source_sentence: 佛說是已，復作頌曰：「欲瞋及怖癡，　　有此四法者；　名譽日損減，　　如月向于晦。」
translation: After the Buddha said this, he also composed a verse, "With these four things, desire, anger, fear, and delusion, their reputation is diminished day by day, like the moon facing into the darkness."

source_sentence: 佛告善生：「若長者、長者子於此四處不為惡者，則有增益。」
translation: The Buddha told Shangsheng, "If an elder or an elder son doesn't do evil in these four places, then there will be gain."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊重作頌曰：「於欲恚怖癡，　　不為惡行者，　名譽日增廣，　　如月向上滿。」
translation: At that point, the Bhagavān then composed this verse, "Someone who doesn't behave badly in desire, anger, fear, or delusion will have their reputation increased and broadened day by day, like the moon going upward to its full height."

source_sentence: 佛告善生：「六損財業者：一者耽湎於酒，二者博戱，三者放蕩，四者迷於伎樂，五者惡友相得，六者懈墮，是為六損財業。
translation: The Buddha told Shangsheng, "The six actions that harm wealth are: 1) indulging in alcohol, 2) engaging in drama, 3) debauchery, 4) being addicted to pleasure, 5) having bad friends, and 6) being lazy.

source_sentence: 善生！
translation: Well born!

source_sentence: 若長者、長者子解知四結行，不於四處而為惡行，復知六損財業，是為，善生！
translation: If an elder or an elder's son understands the four binding practices, doesn't engage in bad behavior in the four places, and knows the six harmful actions, this is, good birth!

source_sentence: 於四處得離，供養六方，今善後善，今世根基，後世根基，於現法中，智者所譽，獲世一果，身壞命終，生天、善處。
translation: They attain freedom from the four places, make offerings to the six directions, become good in the present and good in the future, have the roots of the present life and the roots of the future life, attain the single worldly fruit in the present life, and are born in a heaven or a good place when their bodies break up and their lives end.

source_sentence: 善生！
translation: Well born!

source_sentence: 當知飲酒有六失：一者失財，二者生病，三者鬪諍，四者惡名流布，五者恚怒暴生，六者智慧日損。
translation: You should know that drinking alcohol has six faults: first, you lose your money, second, you get sick, third, you fight, fourth, a bad reputation spreads, fifth, anger arises, and sixth, your wisdom is impaired day by day.

source_sentence: 善生！
translation: Well born!

source_sentence: 若彼長者、長者子飲酒不已，其家產業日日損減。
translation: If that elder or elder's son doesn't stop drinking, his family's property declines day by day.

source_sentence: 善生！
translation: Be well born!

source_sentence: 博戱有六失，云何為六？
translation: There are six faults in pārājika, what are the six?

source_sentence: 一者財產日耗，二者雖勝生怨，三者智者所責，四者人不敬信，五者為人疎外，六者生盜竊心。
translation: One, their property depletes day by day, two, although they may be superior, they become hostile, three, are criticized by wise men, four, are not respected or trusted by others, five, are outsiders, and six, give rise to thoughts of theft.

source_sentence: 善生！
translation: Well born!

source_sentence: 是為博戱六失。
translation: These are the six faults of playfulness.

source_sentence: 若長者、長者子博戱不已，其家產業日日損減，放蕩有六失：一者不自護身，二者不護財貨，三者不護子孫，四者常自驚懼，五者諸苦惡法常自纏身，六者喜生虛妄，是為放蕩六失。
translation: If an elder or an elder son doesn't stop engaging in drama, his family's property declines day by day, and there are six faults in debauchery: first, not protecting themselves, second, not protecting their possessions, third, not protecting their children and grandchildren, fourth, always being afraid, fifth, always being tethered by painful and bad qualities, and sixth, delighting in falsehoods, these are the six faults of debauchery.

source_sentence: 若長者、長者子放蕩不已，其家財產日日損減。
translation: If an elder or an elder's son doesn't stop debauching, their family's possessions will decrease day by day.

source_sentence: 「善生！
translation: "Good sons!

source_sentence: 迷於伎樂復有六失：一者求歌，二者求舞，三者求琴瑟，四者波內早，五者多羅槃，六者首呵那，是為伎樂六失。
translation: Also, there are six faults when they are deluded in music: one, seeking song, two, seeking dance, three, seeking lutes, four, pānaśāl, five, turapan, and six, svāhana.

source_sentence: 若長者、長者子伎樂不已，其家財產日日損減，惡友相得復有六失：一者方便生欺，二者好喜屏處，三者誘他家人，四者圖謀他物，五者財利自向，六者好發他過，是為惡友六失。
translation: If an elder or an elder's son doesn't stop playing, and his family's property decreases day by day, there are another six faults associated with bad friends: first, deception by convenience, second, liking quiet places, third, enticing other family members, fourth, scheming for other's goods, fifth, making profits for oneself, and sixth, lusting after other's faults.

source_sentence: 若長者、長者子習惡友不已，其家財產日日損減，懈墮有六失：一者富樂不肯作務，二者貧窮不肯勤修，三者寒時不肯勤修，四者熱時不肯勤修，五者時早不肯勤修，六者時晚不肯勤修，是為懈墮六失。
translation: If an elder or an elder's son doesn't stop cultivating bad friendships, his family's property decreases day by day, and he becomes lazy and falls into six errors: first, he's rich and happy and won't work, second, he's poor and won't work hard, third, he won't work hard when it's cold, fourth, he won't work hard when it's hot, fifth, he won't work hard in the morning, and sixth, he won't work hard at night.

source_sentence: 若長者、長者子懈墮不已，其家財業日日損減。」
translation: If an elder or an elder's son doesn't stop being lazy, the wealth of his family will decrease day by day."

source_sentence: 佛說是已，復作頌曰：「迷惑於酒者，　　還有酒伴黨；　財產正集聚，　　隨己復散盡。
translation: After the Buddha said this, he also composed a verse, "A person who's deluded about alcohol and has companions in alcoholic beverages has his wealth and property accumulated and then scattered after himself.

source_sentence: 飲酒無節度，　　常喜歌舞戱；　晝則遊他家，　　因此自陷墜。
translation: They drink alcohol without restraint, often enjoying singing, dancing, and drama; they travel to other homes by day and thus fall into their own misfortune.

source_sentence: 隨惡友不改，　　誹謗出家人；　邪見世所嗤，　　行穢人所黜。
translation: He follows bad friends who don't change, denigrating renunciant monks; his wrong views are despised by the world, and his actions are condemned by others.

source_sentence: 好惡著外色，　　但論勝負事；　親要無返復，　　行穢人所黜。
translation: They are attracted to external forms, only discussing victory and defeat; they are intimate with what's wanted and don't return, and behave in ways that defile others.

source_sentence: 為酒所荒迷，　　貧窮不自量；　輕財好奢用，　　破家致禍患。
translation: Being deluded by alcohol, they are poor and don't measure themselves; they despise wealth and enjoy extravagance, which ruins their family and causes misfortune.

source_sentence: 擲博群飲酒，　　共伺他婬女；　翫習卑鄙行，　　如月向於晦。
translation: They toss away wine, drink in crowds, share the company of other women, and indulge in despicable behavior like the moon facing the darkness.

source_sentence: 行惡能受惡，　　與惡友同事；　今世及後世，　　終始無所獲。
translation: Doing evil leads to receiving evil, and they associate with evil friends; in this world and the next, they'll end up with nothing.

source_sentence: 晝則好睡眠，　　夜覺多悕望；　獨昏無善友，　　不能修家務。
translation: They prefer sleep in the daytime and long for it in the nighttime; they're alone in darkness with no good friends, and they can't cultivate household chores.

source_sentence: 朝夕不肯作，　　寒暑復懈墮；　所為事不究，　　亦復毀成功。
translation: He refuses to work in the morning and evening, and he becomes lazy in the cold and heat; he doesn't investigate what he's doing, and it often disrupts his success.

source_sentence: 若不計寒暑，　　朝夕勤修務；　事業無不成，　　至終無憂患。」
translation: If we don't count the cold and heat, and we work hard every morning and night, there'll be no failure in our tasks, and we won't be miserable until the end of our lives."

source_sentence: 佛告善生：「有四怨如親，汝當覺知。
translation: The Buddha told Sangsheng, "There are four enemies like family members that you should know.

source_sentence: 何謂為四？
translation: What are the four?

source_sentence: 一者畏伏，二者美言，三者敬順，四者惡友。」
translation: One is to be feared, two is to speak well, three is to be obeyed, and four is to have bad friends."

source_sentence: 佛告善生：「畏伏有四事，云何為四？
translation: The Buddha told Sunāṅga, "There are four things to fear and subdue, and what are the four?

source_sentence: 一者先與後奪，二者與少望多，三者畏故強親，四者為利故親，是為畏伏四事。」
translation: One, giving first and then taking second, two, giving less and hoping for more, three, being intimate because of fear, and four, being intimate because of gain are four things to fear and subdue."

source_sentence: 佛告善生：「美言親復有四事，云何為四？
translation: The Buddha told Shangsheng, "Also, there are four things that are said to be intimate, so what are the four?

source_sentence: 一者善惡斯順，二者有難捨離，三者外有善來密止之，四者見有危事便排濟之，是為美言親四事。
translation: One, they are obedient to good and evil, two, they abandon difficulties, three, they are well-supported by external goodness, and four, they rescue someone who sees something dangerous, which are the four things that are called beautiful and intimate.

source_sentence: 敬順親復有四事，云何為四？
translation: There are another four things to honor and obey, and what are the four?

source_sentence: 一者先誑，二者後誑，三者現誑，四者見有小過便加杖之，是為敬順親四事。
translation: One that deceives first, two that deceives later, three that deceives presently, and four that sees a minor misdeed and then beats it up are four things that honor and obey a relative.

source_sentence: 惡友親復有四事，云何為四？
translation: What are the other four things that bad friends and relatives do?

source_sentence: 一者飲酒時為友，二者博戱時為友，三者婬逸時為友，四者歌舞時為友，是為惡友親四事。」
translation: One, being a friend when drinking alcohol, two, being a friend when gambling, three, being a friend when lusting, and four, being a friend when singing and dancing, are the four things that make a bad friend intimate."

source_sentence: 世尊說此已，復作頌曰：「畏伏而強親，　　美言親亦爾；　敬順虛誑親，　　惡友為惡親。
translation: After the Bhagavān said this, he also composed a verse, "A strong relative who is feared and subdued, a relative who speaks well, and a relative who respects and obeys a false relative are bad relatives.

source_sentence: 此親不可恃，　　智者當覺知；　宜速遠離之，　　如避于嶮道。」
translation: These relatives can't be relied upon, and a wise person should realize that it's better to quickly avoid them, just as you would avoid a dangerous path."

source_sentence: 佛告善生：「有四親可親，多所饒益，為人救護。
translation: The Buddha told Sangsheng, "There are four relatives who are dear, helpful, and helpful to others.

source_sentence: 云何為四？
translation: What are the four?

source_sentence: 一者止非，二者慈愍，三者利人，四者同事，是為四親可親，多所饒益，為人救護，當親近之。
translation: One that stops wrongdoing, two that's kind, three that's for the benefit of others, and four that's for fellow workers are four things that are dear and helpful, and they should be approached by people as a means of support.

source_sentence: 善生！
translation: Well born!

source_sentence: 彼止非有四事，多所饒益，為人救護。
translation: "Are there not four things they do to stop, which are often beneficial and provide protection for others?

source_sentence: 云何為四？
translation: What are the four?

source_sentence: 一者見人為惡則能遮止，二者示人正直，三者慈心愍念，四者示人天路。
translation: One is able to stop people when they see them doing evil, two shows them righteousness, three is compassionate, and four shows them the path to heaven.

source_sentence: 是為四止非，多所饒益，為人救護。
translation: These are the four kinds of suppression of wrongdoing, which often benefit and defend people.

source_sentence: 「復次，慈愍有四事：一者見利代喜，二者見惡代憂，三者稱譽人德，四者見人說惡便能抑制，是為四慈愍，多所饒益，為人救護。
translation: "Furthermore, there are four kinds of compassion: first, seeing benefit instead of joy, second, seeing evil instead of grief, third, praising people's virtue, and fourth, being able to restrain people when they speak evil, these are the four kinds of compassion that are often beneficial and provide protection for others.

source_sentence: 利益有四，云何為四？
translation: There are four benefits, and what are the four?

source_sentence: 一者護彼不令放逸，二者護彼放逸失財，三者護彼使不恐怖，四者屏相教誡，是為四利人，多所饒益，為人救護。
translation: One, guarding them from carelessness, two, guarding them from carelessness and loss of possessions, three, guarding them so they won't be afraid, and four, instructing them calmly are four ways to benefit people, give them lots of benefit, and rescue them.

source_sentence: 同事有四，云何為四？
translation: There are four fellow practitioners, so what are the four?

source_sentence: 一者為彼不惜身命，二者為彼不惜財寶，三者為彼濟其恐怖，四者為彼屏相教誡，是為四同事，多所饒益，為人救護。」
translation: One is to spare no life for them, two is to spare no treasure for them, three is to help their fears, and four is to admonish them with open arms; these are the four coworkers who often work to benefit and rescue people."

source_sentence: 世尊說是已，復作頌曰：「制非防惡親，　　慈愍在他親；　利人益彼親，　　同事齊己親。
translation: After the Bhagavān said this, he also composed this verse, "Restrain wrong intimacy to prevent bad intimacy, be compassionate toward others' intimates, benefit others to improve their intimates, and align your own intimates with co-workers.

source_sentence: 此親乃可親，　　智者所附近；　親中無等親，　　如慈母親子。
translation: This relative is relatable, near whom wise people are close; among relatives, there's no equal relative, like a loving mother to her son.

source_sentence: 若欲親可親，　　當親堅固親；　親者戒具足，　　如火光照人。」
translation: If you want to be intimate, you must be intimate with a strong relative who has the full set of precepts and is like a firelight shining on a person."

source_sentence: 佛告善生：「當知六方，云何為六方？
translation: The Buddha told Shangsheng, "You should know the six directions, but what are the six directions?

source_sentence: 父母為東方，師長為南方，妻婦為西方，親黨為北方，僮僕為下方，沙門、婆羅門、諸高行者為上方。
translation: Parents are to the east, teachers are to the south, wives are to the west, friends are to the north, servants are to the bottom, and ascetics, brāhmaṇas, and those of high moral character are to the top.

source_sentence: 善生！
translation: "Well born!

source_sentence: 夫為人子，當以五事敬順父母，云何為五？
translation: As a human son, you must honor your father and mother with five things, and what are the five?

source_sentence: 一者供奉能使無乏，二者凡有所為先白父母，三者父母所為恭順不逆，四者父母正令不敢違背，五者不斷父母所為正業。
translation: One, making offerings enables them to have no lack, two, whatever they do, they first tell their parents, three, they are obedient and don't disobey what their parents do, four, they don't dare to disobey their parents' proper orders, and five, they don't stop doing what their parents rightly do.

source_sentence: 善生！
translation: Well born!

source_sentence: 夫為人子，當以此五事敬順父母，父母復以五事敬親其子。
translation: "As a human son, a person should honor his parents with these five things, and parents should honor their children with five things.

source_sentence: 云何為五？
translation: What are the five?

source_sentence: 一者制子不聽為惡，二者指授示其善處，三者慈愛入骨徹髓，四者為子求善婚娶，五者隨時供給所須。
translation: One, they restrain their sons from hearing evil, two, they show them good places, three, they love them to the marrow of their bones, four, they seek a good marriage for their sons, and five, they provide for their needs at all times.

source_sentence: 善生！
translation: Well born!

source_sentence: 子於父母敬順恭奉，則彼方安隱，無有憂畏。
translation: When a son respects and venerates his parents, he'll be at peace there, free of sorrow and fear.

source_sentence: 「善生！
translation: "Well born!

source_sentence: 弟子敬奉師長復有五事，云何為五？
translation: What are the five additional things a disciple does to honor his teacher?

source_sentence: 一者給侍所須，二者禮敬供養，三者尊重戴仰，四者師有教勅敬順無違，五者從師聞法善持不忘。
translation: One, they serve what's needed, two, they revere and make offerings, three, they respect and venerate them, four, they honor and obey their teacher's commands without disobeying them, and five, they hear the teaching from their teacher, maintain it well, and don't forget it.

source_sentence: 善生！
translation: Well born!

source_sentence: 夫為弟子當以此五法敬事師長，師長復以五事敬視弟子，云何為五？
translation: A disciple should honor his teacher with these five things, and the teacher should also honor the disciple with five things: what are the five?

source_sentence: 一者順法調御，二者誨其未聞，三者隨其所問令善解義，四者示其善友，五者盡以所知誨授不悋。
translation: One is to tame them according to the teaching, two is to teach them what they haven't heard, three is to follow their questions and make them understand the meaning well, four is to show them good friends, and five is to teach them everything they know and not be stingy.

source_sentence: 善生！
translation: "Well born!

source_sentence: 弟子於師長敬順恭奉，則彼方安隱，無有憂畏。
translation: When a disciple respects and obeys his teacher, he's at ease there, and he has no worries or fears.

source_sentence: 「善生！
translation: "Well born!

source_sentence: 夫之敬妻亦有五事，云何為五？
translation: There are also five things a husband does to honor his wife, and what are they?

source_sentence: 一者相待以禮，二者威嚴不媟，三者衣食隨時，四者莊嚴以時，五者委付家內。
translation: One is to treat each other with respect, two is to be dignified and not lustful, three is to be clothed and fed at all times, four is to be adorned at the right time, and five is to be entrusted to the household.

source_sentence: 善生！
translation: "Well done!

source_sentence: 夫以此五事敬待於妻，妻復以五事恭敬於夫，云何為五？
translation: What are the five things a husband does to honor his wife and the five things a wife does to honor her husband?

source_sentence: 一者先起，二者後坐，三者和言，四者敬順，五者先意承旨。
translation: One rises first, two sits last, three speaks in harmony, four is respectful and compliant, and five acknowledges the intention beforehand.

source_sentence: 善生！
translation: Well born!

source_sentence: 是為夫之於妻敬待，如是則彼方安隱，無有憂畏。
translation: This is the kind of man who treats his wife with respect; thus, he'll be at ease there, with no worries or fears.

source_sentence: 「善生！
translation: "Well born!

source_sentence: 夫為人者，當以五事親敬親族，云何為五？
translation: There are five things with which a person should be intimate and respectful to his or her relatives.

source_sentence: 一者給施，二者善言，三者利益，四者同利，五者不欺。
translation: One is giving, two is speaking well, three is benefiting, four is cooperating, and five is not deceiving.

source_sentence: 善生！
translation: Good birth!

source_sentence: 是為五事親敬親族，親族亦以五事親敬於人，云何為五？
translation: These are the five things that people should do to honor their relatives, and the five things that relatives should do to honor others.

source_sentence: 一者護放逸，二者護放逸失財，三者護恐怖者，四者屏相教誡，五者常相稱歎。
translation: One protects the careless, two protects the loss of possessions through carelessness, three protects the fearful, four admonishes and instructs, and five always praises.

source_sentence: 善生！
translation: "Well born!

source_sentence: 如是敬視親族，則彼方安隱，無有憂畏。
translation: When they thus honor their relatives, they're at ease there, and there's no worry or fear.

source_sentence: 「善生！
translation: "Well born!

source_sentence: 主於僮使以五事教授，云何為五？
translation: What are the five things that the lord teaches to his messengers?

source_sentence: 一者隨能使役，二者飲食隨時，三者賜勞隨時，四者病與醫藥，五者縱其休假。
translation: One can be employed at will, two can eat and drink at any time, three is given labor at any time, four is given medicine for illness, and five is given leave.

source_sentence: 善生！
translation: Good birth!

source_sentence: 是為五事教授僮使，僮使復以五事奉事其主，云何為五？
translation: These are the five things that a messenger teaches, and five things that a messenger serves to his master.

source_sentence: 一者早起，二者為事周密，三者不與不取，四者作務以次，五者稱揚主名。
translation: One, he rises early, two, he conducts his affairs thoughtfully, three, he doesn't take what's not given, four, he takes order in his work, and five, he praises his lord's name.

source_sentence: 是為主待僮使，則彼方安隱，無有憂畏。
translation: This is how a lord treats his messengers, so they're kept safe and have no worries or fears.

source_sentence: 「善生！
translation: "Well born!

source_sentence: 檀越當以五事供奉沙門、婆羅門，云何為五？
translation: Donors should make offerings to ascetics and priests in five ways.

source_sentence: 一者身行慈，二者口行慈，三者意行慈，四者以時施，五者門不制止。
translation: One acts with kindness in body, two acts with kindness in speech, three acts with kindness in mind, four gives with time, and five doesn't stop at the door.

source_sentence: 善生！
translation: "Well born!

source_sentence: 若檀越以此五事供奉沙門、婆羅門，沙門、婆羅門當復以六事而教授之，云何為六？
translation: If a donor offers these five things to a monk or brāhmaṇa, what are the six things that the monk or brāhmaṇa will then teach them?

source_sentence: 一者防護不令為惡，二者指授善處，三者教懷善心，四者使未聞者聞，五者已聞能使善解，六者開示天路。
translation: One protects against evil, two shows them good places, three teaches them to harbor good intentions, four causes those who haven't heard to hear, five enables those who have heard to understand well, and six shows them the way to heaven.

source_sentence: 善生！
translation: "Well born!

source_sentence: 如是檀越恭奉沙門、婆羅門，則彼方安隱，無有憂畏。」
translation: Thus, when a donor respects an ascetic or a brāhmaṇa, that place is peaceful and free of sorrow."

source_sentence: 世尊說已，重說偈曰：「父母為東方，　　師長名南方，　妻婦為西方，　　親族為北方，　僮僕為下方，　　沙門為上方。
translation: After the Bhagavān spoke, he repeated the verse, saying, "Parents are to the east, teachers are to the south, wives are to the west, relatives are to the north, servants are to the bottom, and ascetics are to the top.

source_sentence: 諸有長者子，　　禮敬於諸方；　敬順不失時，　　死皆得生天。
translation: There are sons of elders who revere all directions; when they revere and obey them without fail, they'll all be born in heaven when they die.

source_sentence: 惠施及輭言，　　利人多所益，　同利等彼己，　　所有與人共。
translation: With generosity and words like these, they give much benefit to others, share the same benefit with themselves, and have it shared with others.

source_sentence: 此四多負荷，　　任重如車輪；　世間無此四，　　則無有孝養。
translation: These four are often burdensome, and their load is as heavy as a chariot wheel; without them, the world would have no filial support.

source_sentence: 此法在世間，　　智者所撰擇；　行則獲大果，　　名稱遠流布。
translation: This is a teaching that exists in the world, that wise men choose, that achieves great results when practiced, and that spreads far and wide in reputation.

source_sentence: 嚴飾於床座，　　供設上飲食；　供給所當得，　　名稱遠流布。
translation: It's adorned on a seat, provided with excellent food and drink, and given a name that spreads far and wide as an offering that should be obtained.

source_sentence: 親舊不相遺，　　示以利益事；　上下常和同，　　於此得善譽。
translation: Not abandoning old and new, he shows them what's good; always harmonizing with those below, he attains a good reputation here.

source_sentence: 先當習伎藝，　　然後獲財業；　財業既已具，　　宜當自守護。
translation: First, you must train in the arts, then you'll acquire wealth; once wealth and property are complete, you should guard it yourself.

source_sentence: 出財未至奢，　　當撰擇前人；　欺誑觝突者，　　寧乞未舉與。
translation: When you've produced wealth that's not yet extravagant, you must choose those who came before you; those who deceive and resist would rather be left untouched.

source_sentence: 積財從小起，　　如蜂集眾花；　財寶日滋息，　　至終無損耗。
translation: Accumulating wealth starts small, like a bee gathering many flowers; each day, his wealth grows in strength, and he never loses it in the end.

source_sentence: 一食知止足，　　二修業勿怠，　三當先儲積，　　以擬於空乏，　四耕田商賈，　　澤地而置牧，　五當起塔廟，　　六立僧房舍，　在家勤六業，　　善修勿失時。
translation: First, he should know when he's had enough to eat, second, he shouldn't neglect his work, third, he should first save up for a shortage, fourth, he should plow fields for merchants and grazing land for swamps, fifth, he should build stūpas and temples, sixth, he should erect a monk's dormitory, and he should diligently pursue the six activities at home, cultivating them well so as not to lose track of time.

source_sentence: 如是修業者，　　則家無損減；　財寶日滋長，　　如海吞眾流。」
translation: When you thus cultivate your actions, your family will not be diminished; your wealth will grow day by day, like an ocean swallowing up innumerable streams."

source_sentence: 爾時，善生白世尊言：「甚善！
translation: It was then that the good sentient being said to the Bhagavān, "Very good!

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 實過本望，踰我父教，能使覆者得仰，閉者得開，迷者得悟，冥室燃燈，有目得視。
translation: It's really beyond my father's teaching to cause those who are covered to be raised, those who are shut up to be opened, those who are deluded to be enlightened, and those whose rooms are dark to be lit by a lamp so that their eyes can see.

source_sentence: 如來所說，亦復如是，以無數方便，開悟愚冥，現清白法。
translation: Tathāgata's teaching is likewise, using countless methods to enlighten the foolish and present the pure and clear Dharma.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 佛為如來、至真、等正覺，故能開示，為世明導。
translation: Because the Buddha is the Tathāgata, the supreme truth, and the perfectly enlightened one, he is able to reveal and guide the world with insight.

source_sentence: 今我歸依佛、歸依法、歸依僧，唯願世尊聽我於正法中為憂婆塞，自今日始，盡形壽不殺、不盜、不婬、不欺、不飲酒。」
translation: Now, I take refuge in the Buddha, in the Dharma, and in the saṃgha, and I ask the Bhagavān to listen to me as a layman in the right Dharma who, from this day forward, spends his whole life not killing, not stealing, not committing sexual misconduct, not deceiving, and not drinking alcohol."

source_sentence: 爾時，善生聞佛所說，歡喜奉行。
translation: At the time, Shangsheng heard what the Buddha taught, rejoiced, and approved.
